articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
Our dear friend Robin has a new essay called In Praise of Shadows. Now, before you hop over there looking for nuggets on CSS box shadows, text shadows, and shadow filtersâ€¦ this is not that. Itâ€™s an essay â€¦
In Praise of Shadows originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: In Praise of Shadows

articles.author: Eluda
articles.description:
HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, PHP, C++, Dart â€” there are so many programming languages out there and you may even be totally fluent in several of them! But as we aim to write more and better code, the way we â€¦
Technical Writing for Developers originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Technical Writing for Developers

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
Melanie Sumner has this super-specific collection of web-related nouns for describing a group or set of something. You know how thereâ€™s a school or fish or a herd of cows? Same sort of thing, but for funny web jargon.
Things â€¦
Collective Nouns for the Web originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Collective Nouns for the Web

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
For thisÂ fourth andÂ finalÂ article of ourÂ little seriesÂ on single-element loaders, we are going to explore 3D patterns. When creating a 3D element, itâ€™s hard to imagine thatÂ justÂ oneÂ HTMLÂ elementÂ isÂ enough to simulateÂ something like allÂ sixÂ faces of a cube. But Â maybe we can get away â€¦
Single Element Loaders: Going 3D! originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Single Element Loaders: Going 3D!

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
Bunny Fonts bills itself as the â€œprivacy-first web font platform designed to put privacy back into the internet.â€ According to its FAQ:
With a zero-tracking and no-logging policy, Bunny Fonts helps you stay fully GDPR compliant and puts your userâ€™s 
â€¦
Bunny Fonts originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Bunny Fonts

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
Eric Eggert:
There are a few legitimate use cases for this technique. For example, you might have a table with titles and descriptions. To preserve more space for the title, you constrain the description to one line on small 
â€¦

articles.title: Text-overflow: ellipsis considered harmful

articles.author: Holger Sindbaek
articles.description:
There is an abundance of both CSS and JavaScript libraries for animation libraries out there. So many, in fact, that choosing the right one for your project can seem impossible. Thatâ€™s the situation I faced when I decided to build â€¦
How I Chose an Animation Library for My Solitaire Game originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: How I Chose an Animation Library for My Solitaire Game

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:
We all make mistakes in our code. It happens! I know if I had one of those â€œDays Since Last Mistakeâ€ signs hanging over my desk, a big olâ€™ goose egg would be hovering above me all the time. It â€¦

articles.author: Victor Adedokun
articles.description:
Right after â€œWhere is the best place to learn?â€ perhaps the most commonly asked question I hear from folks getting into code is â€œWhat web development books should I get to learn?â€ Well, consider this an answer to that question â€¦
Great (and Free!) Web Development Books You Can Get Online originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Great (and Free!) Web Development Books You Can Get Online

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
Weâ€™ve looked at spinners. Weâ€™ve looked at dots. Now weâ€™re going to tackle another common pattern for loaders: bars. And weâ€™re going to do the same thing in this third article of the series as we have the others â€¦
Single Element Loaders: The Bars originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Single Element Loaders: The Bars

articles.author: Saleh Mubashar
articles.description:
Weâ€™re all familiar with the standard way of linking up a stylesheet to the <head> of an HTML doc, right? Thatâ€™s just one of several ways weâ€™re able to write CSS. But what does it look like to style things â€¦

articles.title: Different Ways to Write CSS in React

articles.author: Temani Afif
articles.description:
Weâ€™re looking at loaders in this series. More than that, weâ€™re breaking down some common loader patterns and how to re-create them with nothing more than a single div. So far, weâ€™ve picked apart the classic spinning loader. Now, â€¦

articles.title: Single Element Loaders: The Dots

articles.author: Preethi
articles.description:
Calendars, shopping carts, galleries, file explorers, and online libraries are some situations where selectable items are shown in grids (i.e. square lattices). You know, even those security checks that ask you to select all images with crosswalks or whatever.
ğŸ§â€¦
Conditionally Styling Selected Elements in a Grid Container originally published on CSS-Tricks. You should get the newsletter.
articles.title: Conditionally Styling Selected Elements in a Grid Container

articles.author: Geoff Graham
articles.description:

I think â€¦
